intro: Trachyandra malosana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved trachyandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers in summer, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections.
